page.title: 14LONGDEN C.E.(AIDED) PRIMARY
page.content: The children who have compiled the material for this survey all go to Lomgden Primary School which has 114 pupils on roll and four assistant teachers and a headmaster. The school is a church aided school and recently the Governors voted to keep the school's aided status and this was supported by the local Parochial Church Council. The school has four classes and is housed in buildings which were opened in 1954. The old school buildings, dating back to the 1860's, are now a private dwelling approximately 100 yards from the new site. The new buildings were opened in 1954 when the neighbourhood schools at Pulverbatch and Hook-a-gate were closed and the old school building was too small to house the amalgamated pupil population.
